content: Investments STI ETF DBS Asked by Paris BoonAsked 2w agoWill the STI ETF be good for long term (10 years time period) investment?I'm 19 this year and am planning to invest 100$ per month into DBS STI ETF. Was wondering if it's a good idea.1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

SLSamuel Lee, Financial Planner at Advisor Alliance Group (AIA)Level 3. WonderkidAnswered 2w agoHi, I feel really excited for you as you embark on your investment journey!
DBS STI ETF is a good start in the sense that you would be "buying into Singapore economy" and a decently safe start with moderate risk considering Singapore current market environment.
It's good to see that you are also considering DCA as an approach.
However, for a long term investment, you might want to look into other markets that generate higher returns (S&P 500) or a basket of ETFs that can be easily accessed by you through robo-advisors.Based on historical records (Not reflective of future returns), S&P500 has generated higher returns compared to STI ETFs.I personally still invest in STI ETFs, mainly because of my belief that I will be entrenched in Singapore's economy for a long period :)1 comment1
